{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.12746v1", "title": "A note on one-variable theorems for NSOP", "summary": "We give an example of an SOP theory $T$, such that any $L(M)$-formula
$\varphi(x,y)$ with $|y|=1$ is NSOP. We show that any such $T$ must have the
independence property. We also give a simplified proof of Lachlan's theorem
that if every $L$-formula $\varphi(x,y)$ with $|x|=1$ is NSOP, then $T$ is
NSOP.", "main_category": "math.LO", "categories": "math.LO", "published": "2025-04-17T08:38:02Z"}
